content:
• Friday, June 8, 2012
  • STP

    Bloomberg sees a ray of hope for Chinese solar stocks, expecting China to dominate solar panel...

    Bloomberg sees a ray of hope for Chinese solar stocks, expecting China to dominate solar panel sales growth in 2012 with rising demand in China offsetting declines in Europe. China's five largest solar panel makers - STP -5.8%, YGE +1.5%, TSL +3.4%, CSIQ -1.8%, HSOL -1% - are projected to hike 2012 shipments by 27%-37% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • COO

    Baird says the weakness in Cooper Companies (COO -2%) on the back of its earnings miss is a...

    Baird says the weakness in Cooper Companies (COO -2%) on the back of its earnings miss is a buying opportunity. The firm notes that, despite the headlines of an earnings miss, the outlook remains unchanged and the fundamentals are still healthy. It reiterates an Outperform ratint on the shares with a $92 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • TXT

    Textron (TXT +1.2%) says it has been selected by the Canadian government to manufacture 500...

    Textron (TXT +1.2%) says it has been selected by the Canadian government to manufacture 500 vehicles with an option for up to 100 more for the country's Forces Tactical Armoured Patrol in a ~$603M deal. The first vehicle is scheduled to be delivered in July 2014 and continue into 2016.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • CHK

    After a sweeping rebuke representing "total collapse of investor confidence" in Chesapeake's...

    After a sweeping rebuke representing "total collapse of investor confidence" in Chesapeake's (CHK +3%) board - shareholders rejected two directors up for re-election and only 20% approved CEO compensation - is Aubrey McClendon's ouster next? Two-thirds of CHK’s board could be new appointees by July 1, and McClendon won’t have hand-picked any of them.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 14 Comments
  • OCZ

    Strength in OCZ Tech (OCZ +10.2%) is attributed to a report suggesting the computer hardware...

    Strength in OCZ Tech (OCZ +10.2%) is attributed to a report suggesting the computer hardware manufacturer has won Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) Azure business. Among various features added to Azure, sources say new "storage hardware" is thought to include OCZ solid state drives.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 5 Comments
  • STX

    Brean Murray says it's far too early to change its bullish stance on disk drive stocks, despite...

    Brean Murray says it's far too early to change its bullish stance on disk drive stocks, despite declining unit shipments and concerns over ASP's. The firm notes their channel checks look reasonable relative to guidance and that numbers are coming down towards their estimates from higher Street estimates. The firm maintains Buy ratings on both Seagate (STX +3.5%) and Western Digital (WDC +1.5%)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • ONXX

    Onxx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +7.6%) shares surge after BofA Merrill issues an upgrade to Buy...

    Onxx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +7.6%) shares surge after BofA Merrill issues an upgrade to Buy and raises its target price to $57 from $47, citing high expectations for Kyprolis. Physician feedback has turned significantly more supportive on Kyprolis efficacy, the firm says, expecting the trend to continue as experts gain experience and publish long-term follow-up results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • NVO

    Novo Nordisk (NVO -2.1%) shares slip after announcing the FDA extended the regulatory review...

    Novo Nordisk (NVO -2.1%) shares slip after announcing the FDA extended the regulatory review period by three months for the drug maker's ultra-long-acting insulins degludec and insulin degludec/insulin aspart for the treatment of type 1 and type 2 diabetes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • BMS

    Bemis (BMS +2%) moves up on a BofA Merrill Lynch upgrade to Buy , citing its defensive...

    Bemis (BMS +2%) moves up on a BofA Merrill Lynch upgrade to Buy , citing its defensive characteristics given its positive margin, favorable yield outlook and strong relative volumes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • UBS

    UBS' (UBS -1%) loss on Facebook trading could be as much as $350M, reports CNBC, and the company...

    UBS' (UBS -1%) loss on Facebook trading could be as much as $350M, reports CNBC, and the company is said to be preparing legal action against Nasdaq (NDAQ -0.5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 4 Comments
  • TITN

    Titan Machinery (TITN +3.6%) pops after Craig-Hallum says the sell-off is way overdone, just a...

    Titan Machinery (TITN +3.6%) pops after Craig-Hallum says the sell-off is way overdone, just a severe overreaction to a slight earnings miss, given that valuation is not stretched and demand has not softened. The firm reiterates a Buy rating and $38 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • VOCS

    Vocus (VOCS +3.4%) strategy shift should yield better growth profile, says FBR Capital. After...

    Vocus (VOCS +3.4%) strategy shift should yield better growth profile, says FBR Capital. After attending a number of events held by the company, FBR thinks VOCS is successfully transforming to a digital marketing suite company, which should open it to a larger addressable market and result in a better growth profile.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • WD

    Walker & Dunlop (WD +6.7%) flies higher after buying CWCapital for about $220M. Both...

    Walker & Dunlop (WD +6.7%) flies higher after buying CWCapital for about $220M. Both companies are commercial lenders, particularly in the apartment sector. The acquisition will make W&D the 2nd largest multi-family lender in a country in which rentals are the big new thing. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NTAP -2.8%) slides on a downgrade to Equal Weight on valuation at Barclays today, citing...

    NetApp (NTAP -2.8%) slides on a downgrade to Equal Weight on valuation at Barclays today, citing macro economic and FX headwinds, plus increased competition. The firm lowers its price target to $34 from $35.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -13.4%) shares are crushed after the company's would-be new...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -13.4%) shares are crushed after the company's would-be new CEO quit just days after his appointment was announced. Matt McCarroll resigned last night after a dispute over his employment contract.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • MNST

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST +2.3%) trade higher in advance of a shareholder meeting...

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST +2.3%) trade higher in advance of a shareholder meeting (webcast) set to start in less than an hour. SA author David Silver says the company won't be casualty of a slow economy, with an energy drink craze just hitting its stride in the U.S. and that has room to grow globally.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • CAMP

    CalAmp (CAMP +17.3%) soars, hitting new year highs after the company raised its outlook for Q1...

    CalAmp (CAMP +17.3%) soars, hitting new year highs after the company raised its outlook for Q1 earlier this morning. The company now expects Q1 revenue in the range of $43.5M - $44M, versus prior guidance of $38M - $41M. EPS is seen in the range of $0.17 - $0.18 versus a previous view of $0.10 - $0.14 per share. The Street view is for $38.7M in revenue and earnings of $0.12 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • YELP

    Shares of YELP rip 9.1% higher and are now up 22% for the week after stumbling around on Monday....

    Shares of YELP rip 9.1% higher and are now up 22% for the week after stumbling around on Monday. While the company has made some inroads in growing its global presence, the rally appears to be driven partially by technical factors and a squeeze on the shorts who raised their interest when Facebook starting faltering. Another big consideration for Yelp is that the iPhone's chatty assistant Siri appears to be a fan.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • PPO

    Polypore (PPO +1.7%) should benefit from increased Volt sales , says Needham. The firm expects...

    Polypore (PPO +1.7%) should benefit from increased Volt sales , says Needham. The firm expects significantly higher electric vehicle adoption rates in the U.S. this year, and GM is already on track to sell more Volt electric vehicles in the first half than it did in all of last year. Needham reiterates a Strong Buy rating on the stock with a $62 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • PVAC

    Penn Virginia (PVA -2.2%) provides an update on its Lavaca County Eagle Ford Shale operations:...

    Penn Virginia (PVA -2.2%) provides an update on its Lavaca County Eagle Ford Shale operations: Schacherl #1H, PVA's third exploratory earning well, was completed and turned in-line with an average initial production rate of 1,277 boe/day of wellhead volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN +4%) pops after Needham raises its price target for the shares to $25...

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN +4%) pops after Needham raises its price target for the shares to $25 from $20, citing positive data presented at ASCO regarding the company's ongoing Adcetris clinical trials. Needham believes the company may succeed in adding re-treatment to the drug's label later this year, and thinks it will fill an important role in future oncology procedures.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • MPWR

    Monolithic Power (MPWR +7%) trades up after Stifel Nicolaus upped the shares to Buy this...

    Monolithic Power (MPWR +7%) trades up after Stifel Nicolaus upped the shares to Buy this morning, citing the company's new product strategy, end market diversification, attractive financial model and solid free cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • HRS

    Shares of Harris (HRS +0.1%) move up, after sitting in negative territory, with a report...

    Shares of Harris (HRS +0.1%) move up, after sitting in negative territory, with a report breaking tipping off that the company hired an adviser to help it sell its broadcast unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • THO

    Thor Industries (THO -5.6%) slips after missing its FQ3 results earlier today. Net profit rose...

    Thor Industries (THO -5.6%) slips after missing its FQ3 results earlier today. Net profit rose slightly as the recreational-vehicle maker's sales strengthened, but margins narrowed due to an elevated RV promotional environment which pressured its bottom line. Gross margin narrowed to 11.8% from 12.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) launches App Center - an Apple/Google-like online directory of downloadable...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) launches App Center - an Apple/Google-like online directory of downloadable apps. The company is trying to attract more software developers and allowing its users a better way to find apps on the site should help. Shares +4.1% and threatening to go green for the week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • WMT

    Shares of Wal-Mart (WMT +2.4%) push higher, helped in part by a report of a double-digit gain in...

    Shares of Wal-Mart (WMT +2.4%) push higher, helped in part by a report of a double-digit gain in sales for Mexican unit Walmex. Yet another 52-week high has been etched out by shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 7 Comments
  • HAL

    A rise in natural gas fracking costs could crimp Halliburton (HAL -2.2%) shares, Susquehanna...

    A rise in natural gas fracking costs could crimp Halliburton (HAL -2.2%) shares, Susquehanna writes, as the firm chops its price target and earnings estimates for the next three years. While HAL has been able to pass through prior price inflation due to a red-hot pressure pumping market, the firm now sees a sequential decline by 500-550 bps in North American margins due to guar gum inflation.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 5 Comments
  • QADA

    Enterprise software developer QAD (QADA +1%) are active this morning after announcing late...

    Enterprise software developer QAD (QADA +1%) are active this morning after announcing late yesterday it had acquired Strasbourg, France-based DynaSys S.A., a provider of supply chain planning software solutions, for around $7.5M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • ZQK

    Shares of Quicksilver (ZQK +11.1%) take flight after the company misses on both the top and...

    Shares of Quicksilver (ZQK +11.1%) take flight after the company misses on both the top and bottom line with its FQ2 report, but makes favorable comments about its expected results for H2. The company sees reducing inventory levels after the fall season, a move which help it largely curb its need for clearance activities. (More on ZQK earnings: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • RIO

    Miners everywhere are feeling the pinch from falling prices, but operators in Australia face the...

    Miners everywhere are feeling the pinch from falling prices, but operators in Australia face the extra challenge of soaring labor costs plus carbon and mining taxes that soon take effect. "There's been such demand for gear over the last few years and mining guys get paid $140,000 to drive a dump truck. It's a joke... It's all going to come home to roost now." Y/Y: RIO -35%, BHP -32%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 6 Comments
  • NAV

    Carl Icahn raises his stake in Navistar International (NAV +5.1%) to 11.87% from 9.99%,...

    Carl Icahn raises his stake in Navistar International (NAV +5.1%) to 11.87% from 9.99%, according to a SEC filing. The activist investor made his purchases yesterday, amid a 28% loss in Navistar's share price.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • YUM

    Shares of Yum Brands (YUM -4.4%) take it on the chin after a warning from McDonald's puts a...

    Shares of Yum Brands (YUM -4.4%) take it on the chin after a warning from McDonald's puts a spotlight back on the company's own ambitions to grow sales globally in the face of a dicey economic climate.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -2.8%) plans to reduce its Kentucky coal mining operations, which...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -2.8%) plans to reduce its Kentucky coal mining operations, which will cut thermal coal shipments by an additional 2M tons this year and 4M tons in 2013. ANR will discontinue mining at four mines and idle two coal preparation plants, production will be scaled back at several other mines, and four contract mines will close.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM | 7 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) jumps 5% premarket on an unconfirmed rumor it could be a takeover target for...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) jumps 5% premarket on an unconfirmed rumor it could be a takeover target for Samsung.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 16 Comments
  • FRAN

    Shares of Francesca Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) extend their post-earnings AH gain and are now up...

    Shares of Francesca Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) extend their post-earnings AH gain and are now up 15.6% premarket. The company's big boost in FY12 guidance on top of stellar same-store sales dazzled in comparison to recent reports from other retailers that trended toward the sentiment that shoppers are getting thriftier.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • MOH

    Premarket gainers: MOH +19%. CTFO +19%. FRAN +14%. NOK +6%. Losers: ATPG -13%. OTCPK:IMUC -10%....

    Premarket gainers: MOH +19%. CTFO +19%. FRAN +14%. NOK +6%.
    Losers: ATPG -13%. OTCPK:IMUC -10%. COO -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • JWN

    Buckingham Partners upgrades Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) to Buy from Neutral on a valuation call and...

    Buckingham Partners upgrades Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) to Buy from Neutral on a valuation call and optimism fueled by the notion that the retailer's e-commerce channel can add to results. The firm's price target of $60 on JWN reps 26% upside. JWN +0.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • CTFO

    China TransInfo Technology (NASDAQ:CTFO) +17.3% premarket after the transportation information...

    China TransInfo Technology (NASDAQ:CTFO) +17.3% premarket after the transportation information company agrees to be bought by TransCloud Co. for $5.80/share in cash.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • MCD

    Though it's not a new warning, McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) spooks investors by saying that global...

    Though it's not a new warning, McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) spooks investors by saying that global economic volatility and austerity measures in Europe will "significantly pressure" Q2 results. The company also notes that at current exchange rates, its foreign currency translation will negatively impact Q2 EPS by $0.07-$0.09. MCD -2.9% premarket. (Previous: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM | 3 Comments
  • CNC

    Centene (NYSE:CNC) +11.1% premarket after receiving notification from Ohio that it will be...

    Centene (NYSE:CNC) +11.1% premarket after receiving notification from Ohio that it will be awarded a Medicaid contract in the state in 2013. The reversal of an earlier decision is vital for Centene and Molina (MOH +19.3%), which received similar news, since both health care providers have large presences in Ohio. Aetna (NYSE:AET) was dropped from Ohio's list of Medicaid plans that will serve starting Jan. 1.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • CHK

    Following the purchase of Chesapeake Energy's (NYSE:CHK) interests, Chesapeake Midstream...

    Following the purchase of Chesapeake Energy's (NYSE:CHK) interests, Chesapeake Midstream Partners (CHKM) affirms EBITA guidance for FY 2012 of $475M with expansion capital expenditures of $660M and maintenance capital expenditures of $74M. CHKM +2.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • MCD

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) reports global comparable sales were up 3.3% in May. Sales rose 4.4% in...

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) reports global comparable sales were up 3.3% in May. Sales rose 4.4% in the U.S. as new breakfast items contributed and Europe saw a 2.9% gain, but Asia/Pacific, Middle East and Africa saw a drop off of 1.7% for the month. Shares -2.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) confirms it plans to sell its assets in Chesapeake Midstream...

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) confirms it plans to sell its assets in Chesapeake Midstream Partners (CHKM) to Global Infrastructure Partners in three separate transactions for expected cash proceeds of more than $4B. CHK says the midstream divestitures will enable it to reduce previously budgeted capex by ~$3B over the next three years. CHK +2.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM

  • More reversals from yesterday's brief melt-up on the PBOC rate cut: WTI crude -3.1% to $82.18...

    More reversals from yesterday's brief melt-up on the PBOC rate cut: WTI crude -3.1% to $82.18 after popping to near $87 24 hours ago. Gold to $1,578 from $1,630. Copper to $3.28 from $3.42.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 AM

  • Crude futures tumble 2.3% to $82.86. Natural gas (-0.9%) and gasoline (-1.3%) aren't looking too...

    Crude futures tumble 2.3% to $82.86. Natural gas (-0.9%) and gasoline (-1.3%) aren't looking too hot either. Disappointment from lack of Fed easing hints? Concerns over upcoming China data? Or just a general bearish sell-off?
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 AM | 4 Comments
